org.hps.readout.ecal.updated

Class GTPClusterReadoutDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
        • org.hps.readout.ecal.updated.GTPClusterReadoutDriver

  • public class GTPClusterReadoutDriver
extends ReadoutDriver
    Class GTPClusterReadoutDriver produces GTP cluster objects for use in the readout trigger simulation. It takes in CalorimeterHit objects as input and generates clusters from these using the GTP algorithm. This algorithm works by selected all hits in the current clock-cycle (4 ns period) and comparing them to adjacent hits. If a given hit is an energy maximum compared to all adjacent hits in both the current clock-cycle, and a number of clock-cycles before and after the current cycle (defined through the variable temporalWindow and set through the method setClusterWindow(int)), then it is a seed hit so long as it also exceeds a certain minimum energy (defined through the variable seedEnergyThreshold and set through the method setSeedEnergyThreshold(double)).

    Clusters are then output as objects of type Cluster to the specified output collection. If the setWriteClusterCollection(boolean) is set to true, the clusters will also be persisted into the output LCIO file.

    • Field Detail

      • inputCollectionName

        private String inputCollectionName
        The name of the collection that contains the calorimeter hits from which clusters should be generated.

      • outputCollectionName

        private String outputCollectionName
        The name of the collection into which generated clusters should be output.

      • temporalWindow

        private int temporalWindow
        The time window used for cluster verification. A seed hit must be the highest energy hit within plus or minus this range in order to be considered a valid cluster.

      • seedEnergyThreshold

        private double seedEnergyThreshold
        The minimum energy needed for a hit to be considered as a seed hit candidate.

      • localTime

        private double localTime
        The local time for the driver. This starts at 2 ns due to a quirk in the timing of the EcalReadoutDriver.

      • localTimeDisplacement

        private double localTimeDisplacement
        The length of time by which objects produced by this driver are shifted due to the need to buffer data from later events. This is calculated automatically.

      • neighborMap

        private HPSEcal3.NeighborMap neighborMap
        An object which can provide, given an argument cell ID, a map of cell IDs that are physically adjacent to the argument ID. This is used to determine adjacency for energy comparisons in the clustering algorithm.

      • calorimeterGeometry

        private HPSEcal3 calorimeterGeometry

        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Generates a Collection containing any special output data produced by the driver that should be included in triggered output.

        Returns a collection containing all special output data.

      • getTimeDisplacement

        protected double getTimeDisplacement()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce its output. This indicates that the driver's present output was generated based on input a time equal to (getCurrentTime() - getTimeDisplacement()).
        Specified by:
        getTimeDisplacement in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • createBasicCluster

        private static final Cluster createBasicCluster(CalorimeterHit seedHit,
                                                List<CalorimeterHit> hits)
        Creates a new cluster object from a seed hit and list of hits.
        Parameters:
        seedHit - - The seed hit of the new cluster.
        hits - - The hits for the new cluster.
        Returns:
        Returns a Cluster object with the specified properties.

      • setClusterWindow

        public void setClusterWindow(int value)
        Sets the size of the hit verification temporal window. Note that this defines the size of the window in one direction, so the full time window will be (2 * clusterWindow)+ 1 clock-cycles in length. (i.e., it will be a length of clusterWindow before the seed hit, a length of clusterWindow after the seed hit, plus the cycle that includes the seed hit.) Time length is in clock-cycles.
        Parameters:
        value - - The number of clock-cycles around the hit in one direction.

      • setSeedEnergyThreshold

        public void setSeedEnergyThreshold(double value)
        Sets the minimum seed energy needed for a hit to be considered for forming a cluster. This is the seed energy lower bound trigger cut and is in units of GeV.
        Parameters:
        value - - The minimum cluster seed energy in GeV.
